metadata.Title: CVE-2018-6067 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Incorrect IPC serialization in Skia in Google Chrome prior to 65.0.3325.146 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6067` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'Ubuntu touch end-of-life').
